entries.npc_1_1: Mikos Dinari is the name, and I do have a problem I could use a bit of help with. There's Tusken Raiders out in the desert that want my hide. You think you could do something about it?
entries.npc_1_2: I'm still having trouble with those blasted Sand People. You did such a bang-up job last time -- maybe you're willing to help me out again?
entries.npc_2_1: I like you young folks. You got good hearts. One of those Tuskens is hot on my trail. I'm safe here in town, but every time I try to leave, he's there waiting. See to it he doesn't bother me anymore, if you can. I surely would be grateful.
entries.npc_2_2: Good hearted! It's what I've always said about you, and I stand by it. Maybe if you were to kill that Tusken Raider chief, they'd decide that I wasn't worth all this trouble.
entries.npc_3_1: Well, danger ain't for everybody, is it? Don't you worry. I'll get by somehow.
entries.npc_3_2: I guess you had your fill of Sand People in that last encounter. Well, don't let an old man waste any more of your time.
entries.npc_4_1: I was out in the desert surveying, and I kind of lost my way. My supplies were running out when I stumbled on to that oasis. Turns out the Sand People are a mite protective of their water sources. I ran. Stumbled across a sandcrawler, and for a small fee, plus the things they managed to steal, the Jawas brought me here.
entries.npc_4_2: I guess they're still angry about my drinking their water. Now their chief is hunting me. Every time I head out into the desert, he and some of his guards track me down, so I have to hightail it back to town.
entries.npc_reward_1: I can't thank you enough for helping me out of that mess. You be careful out in that desert now, y'hear?
entries.npc_reward_2: Thanks to you, I can get back to my surveying and finally earn some credits again. I won't forget this.
entries.player_1_1: Sure.  I can't stand Sand People!
entries.player_1_2: I still hate Sand People.  I'll definitely help.
entries.player_2_1: Sorry, but I don't mess with Sand People.
entries.player_2_2: I'm not sure I want to do any more of this 'killing' thing.  Sorry.
entries.player_3_1: Why are the Sand People angry with you?
entries.player_3_2: What sort of trouble are you having now?
entries.player_reset_1: I'm sorry, but something came up.  I can't do this anymore.
entries.player_sorry_1: Not yet.  Once I find them, they'll be dealt with.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: Thank you for doing this.  This means a lot to me.
entries.npc_reset_1: Well, danger ain't for everybody, is it? Don't you worry. I'll get by somehow.
entries.cantwork: Hey there, friend. Watch yourself out in the desert. It's too easy to get lost. Made trouble for me, but I see you're busy. Come on back later.
entries.npc_work_1: Have you dispatched the Tusken Raiders?
entries.npc_work_2: Are those evil things going to bother me any more?
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Well, when you're victorious, come back and let me know!
entries.npc_reset_2: I guess you had your fill of Sand People in that last encounter. Well, don't let an old man waste any more of your time.
entries.player_reset_2: I'm sorry, but I can't do this anymore.
entries.player_sorry_2: I don't know.  I know that I haven't taken care of them yet for now.
entries.next: I think I'm in the clear thanks to you. If I get in any more trouble I'll let you know.
